sentences: Nad ei tea midagi selle kohta.
context: The word 'teab' is the 3rd person singular form of the Estonian verb 'teada', which means 'to know'. It corresponds to English verbs like 'knows' or 'is aware of'. In Estonian, this verb is used to express knowledge or awareness of something. The root verb 'teada' can be conjugated into different forms: tean (I know), tead (you know/sing.), teab (he/she/it knows), teame (we know), teate (you know/pl.), teavad (they know).
